intro: Aster velutinosus, commonly known as the downy aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of white to pale blue, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a similar downy coating, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aster velutinosus is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands.
